Package org.opensextant.giscore.input

Class XmlInputStream

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.input.GISInputStreamBase
org.opensextant.giscore.input.XmlInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, IGISInputStream
Direct Known Subclasses:
KmlInputStream
public abstract class XmlInputStream extends GISInputStreamBase
Common superclass for Xml based input stream implementations
Author:
DRAND

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes this input stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream. Once the stream has been closed, further read() invocations may throw an IOException. Closing a previously closed stream has no effect.

    • getEncoding

      @NotNull public @NotNull String getEncoding()
      Returns the encoding style of the XML data.
      Returns:
      the character encoding, defaults to "UTF-8". Never null.

    • setEncoding

      protected void setEncoding(String encoding)

    • foundEndTag

      protected boolean foundEndTag(XMLEvent event, String tag)
      Is this event a matching end tag?
      Parameters:
      event - the event
      tag - the tag
      Returns:
      true if this is an end element event for the matching tag

    • foundEndTag

      protected boolean foundEndTag(XMLEvent event, QName name)
      Is this event a matching end tag?
      Parameters:
      event - the event
      name - the qualified name of this event
      Returns:
      true if this is an end element event for the matching tag

      Found a specific start tag
      Parameters:

    • getForeignElement

      @NotNull protected @NotNull IGISObject getForeignElement(StartElement se) throws XMLStreamException
      Unrecognized elements are packaged and returned as Element objects which hold their text and attribute data. These can be processed by consumers and may be output by the output side of XML based processors.
      Parameters:
      se - the start tag, never null
      Returns:
      the element, never null
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML.

    • getSerializedElement

      @NotNull protected @NotNull String getSerializedElement(StartElement start) throws XMLStreamException
      Read the element and then serialize the read element(s) into text
      Parameters:
      start - the start element
      Returns:
      a serialized string
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML.

    • getNonEmptyElementText

      @Nullable protected @Nullable String getNonEmptyElementText() throws XMLStreamException
      Returns non-empty trimmed elementText from stream otherwise null
      Returns:
      non-empty trimmed string, otherwise null
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if the current event is not a START_ELEMENT or if a non text element is encountered

    • getIntegerElementValue

      @Nullable protected @Nullable Integer getIntegerElementValue(String localName) throws XMLStreamException
      Returns Integer from stream if valid otherwise null
      Returns:
      Integer value, otherwise null
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if the current event is not a START_ELEMENT

    • getDoubleElementValue

    • getElementText

      @Nullable protected @Nullable String getElementText(QName name) throws XMLStreamException
      Get non-empty element text.
      Parameters:
      name - the qualified name of this event
      Returns:
      non-empty element text or null if text content is missing, empty or null.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - if there is an error with the underlying XML.
